name: SF Superior Court Self-Help Center
description: Free help with court forms, procedures, and self-representation in SF courts
fullDescription: The SF Superior Court Self-Help Center provides free legal information and assistance to people representing themselves in court matters.
whatTheyOffer:
- Free help with court forms and procedures
- Assistance with family law matters (divorce, custody, support)
- Help with restraining orders
- Small claims court assistance
- Eviction/unlawful detainer guidance
- Referrals to legal aid organizations
howToGetIt:
1. Visit the Self-Help Center at SF Civic Center Courthouse
2. Or call for information
3. No appointment needed for many services
4. Bring your court papers and case information
5. Staff cannot give legal advice but can help with forms and procedures
address: 400 McAllister Street, Room 509, San Francisco, CA 94102
keywords: self-help, court, San Francisco, forms, family law, divorce, custody, restraining order, small claims, eviction, free legal help
